name: Hilton Anchorage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only stayed one night had 12th Floor room, very well appointed, wonderfully comfortable beds.
reviews.title: Very nice room

reviews.text: Small breakfast room, but nice breakfast.
reviews.title: Fine hotel, but nothing extraordinary

reviews.text: Hotel centrally situated.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.text: Very high cost for internet use, however, if you are Hilton Honors siilver and above its free. We'd forgotten our card, couldnt remember the number either but they gave us the access code anyway.
reviews.title: Great rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I travel to Anchorage many times a year for work and have stayed in most of the hotels. To me, a hotel is a hotel for the most part. The Hilton was clean, the room comfortable, the beds and pillows nice, the bath products nice without being perfumy. What I don't like is being nickel and dimed. Pay daily for Internet... And parking... We have a cafe, but it will be $18 minimum for breakfast...
reviews.title: Tops in Anchorage

reviews.text: As a Hilton, this is an old dated hotel. The furniture in my room was damaged and the carpet just looked disgusting. Anchorage is a massive tourist town and this hotel has constant turnover, it was always busy. The hotel is in a good location, walking distance to everything. The big plus of the hotel is the A/C and heat, rooms can get stuffy, no vents in the bathroom (even saw fungus in the ceiling). Hotel is noisy, thin walls. Beds, pillows, and towels are just OK. The restaurant is OK, had breakfast there and the buffet (pricey $18.00/person) was good. There is a take out Starbucks, good little store to buy necessities, etc. There are not a lot of options in Anchorage for high end accomodations. Ate at Sacks cafe, excellent. The Glaciar Brewhouse and Orso are both good. Make sure to make reservations, there are cruise ships in town always. Great salmon, halibut, crab, etc. Lots of tourist type shopping. Have fun!!
reviews.title: Yechy, old, and dated but has air conditioning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel had a lot of business travelers. Staff all extremely nice and helpful. Beds comfortable and room quiet. Beautiful lobby with big mounted bears in cases.
reviews.title: Great place to overnight when you have an early flight.

reviews.text: We had to check-out at 5 a.m., so in 5 minutes, we had the valet get the car, did the Zip-out Check-out, and had the bellman get our luggage. Very efficient. At that time of morning, we arrived at the Avis Rental Return by 5:12. They estimate 20 minutes to the airport, but that early, it was a snap.
reviews.title: Pet Friendly Upgrade!

reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Hilton for five nights before we moved to our next duty station. We have two dogs an even places who say they are pet friendly are usually, at most, pet tolerant. Not so with our experience with the Hilton. We have two dogs and when we checked in they decided to upgrade us to a suite so we would have plenty of room! The staff was the best. So kind and helpful.
reviews.title: OK - Convenient Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here just one night after arriving on a flight in the evening. The room was fine - nice view across the Cook Inlet from an upper floor. Windows that actually opened to allow fresh air in. The room did not appear worn as some reviews state. We had access to the breakfast on the club level and it was good with a nice view and attentive service. Two complaints - (1) the valet parking, the only parking offered, is more expensive than in San Francisco - that's ridiculous for a city the size of Anchorage; the only alternative offered was "Well, you can park on the street between the hours of ..." That's not acceptable for a Hilton. (2) a bit of noise from the bar across the street and motorcycles in the street late at night.
reviews.title: Nice location, but pricey and small rooms

reviews.text: dated and poor. Was a disappointing end to our honey moon. Was booked by our travel agent. Stay at the other Hilton and get a comp transfer service to and from airport
reviews.title: Not what u would expect from a 4* Hilton

reviews.text: rented five rooms for 2 nights. Worked perfect for us, great location, front desk staff was efficient and friendly, the breakfast restaurant wait staff were very good, the valet guys were the best, very helpful, seemed like they really cared about providing world class service. Rooms were clean, not spacious suites, but comfortable. House keeping staff was friendly.
reviews.title: comfortable spot, friendly helpful staff

reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel, comfortable with a solid customer service ethic.
reviews.title: My favorite!

reviews.text: I stayed at the captain cook as well, the Hilton was better. The hotel doesn't have such large groups coming in so it was not as crazy. The rooms were nicer and the prices were better.
reviews.title: Hilton Hotel, Anchorage

reviews.text: A very very nice hotel. After arriving on a flight from L.A. at 1.15am we had a couple of hiccups checking in - i.e. We were given a room key and went up to the room, opened the door and there had been somebody in the room. Whether they were still there or had checked out and the housekeeping hadn't been done I don't know. The 2nd room we were given had people actually asleep in there. (It was about 2am). The 3rd room was all ours though!! Excellent restaurant and very friendly staff.
reviews.title: Choice is limited

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just finished staying two nights at the Hilton Anchorage downtown. Honestly - it's the perfect location, perfect hotel and very clean. We stayed there for two nights and had a room facing the harbor. The location cannot be better - one block from restaurants, Post Office, and the main areas. Really nice hotel
reviews.title: Perfect location in Anchorage

reviews.text: I have stayed at the Hilton Anchorage on four occasions over the last 6 years. We usually stay from 7 to 10 days. The hotel is centrally located and an easy walk to most of the downtown area including the shops, restaurants and tourist attractions.
reviews.title: Love this place..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I understand the hotel has changed ownership and it is showing a little age but the people are still the greatest and customer service is emphasized. We usually stay in a corner room on the Honors Floor. The corner rooms have great views of the mountains, the city and the inlet. The Honors Lounge was one of the best in the system, it is still good and the people are wonderful but no more fresh baked Halibut.. I miss that.
reviews.title: Great location, very clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only gripe is the required valet parking. I hate to wait on my car. They use to have self parking and that was so much easier but then again parking is getting to be a problem in every major city.
reviews.title: Needs a 'make over'

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you can be there on a weekend visit the open air market right across the street for some great buys of local crafts and genuine Alaskan food delights.
reviews.title: Good hotel with spacious rooms

description: One of the most popular hotels in Anchorage.
